result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court Costs and DNA to be paid while the Defendant is on Probation in Milwaukee Co., on 14CF3496. Alternate Civil judgment ordered.

Credit for 159 days.
Court grants TIME SERVED.

Cases 14TR6157, 14TR6158 and 14TR6160 were dismissed and read into: 14CF1193.
Court finds that if the Defendant pays off his court costs and DNA and successfully completes probation in Milwaukee Co., and has no new criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the Defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.

ADDRESS INFO for Xavier Sawyer
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-31-2017)
Prior: W4380 Copper Lake Road, C/O Lincoln Hills School, Irma, WI 54442-9720 United States
Associated with Charge #1
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Xavier Sawyer in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- 159 days jail - 159 days credit. Court Orders Time Served. 
- Court costs of $243.00 to be paid while the defendant is on Probation in Milwaukee County  - case # 14CF3496 - (by October 13, 2017)
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid while the defendant is on Probation in Milwaukee County - Case #14CF3496 - (by October 13, 2017)

Expunction requested by Defense 
Court finds that if the defendant pays off his court costs and DNA Surcharge and successfully completes his probation in Milwaukee County and has no new 
criminal law violations, Court will find that it is in the defendant's interest to have this expunged and society will not be harmed and grant expunction.
